author: Phil Vickery
method: To make the pancakes, place the flour in a bowl and whisk in the egg and enough milk to make a batter.  The batter should be the consistency of double cream. Heat a little oil in a pancake pan and ladle the batter in, swirling the pan to coat. Cook for 1-2 minutes on each side then remove. Repeat to make three pancakes. Meanwhile, mix the spinach, ricotta and nutmeg in a bowl. Lay the pancakes on a clean flat surface. Divide the filling between the pancakes and roll up to secure. Cut on an angle and serve immediately.
ingredients: 85g/3oz plain flour,  1 free-range egg,  milk, to make a batter,  150g/5¼oz spinach, cooked, water squeezed out,  150g/5¼oz ricotta,  pinch grated nutmeg
